definition[0]: to refuse to let someone enter a place or join an organization, for example because it is full
example[0]: The show was so popular police had to turn people away.
example[1]: Thousands of applicants are turned away each year.
definition[1]: to refuse to give someone sympathy, help, or support
example[2]: Anyone who comes to us will not be turned away.
example[3]: The insurance company has promised not to turn away its existing customers.
definition[2]: to stop supporting someone, or stop using or being interested in something, or to make someone do this
example[4]: Consumers are turning away from credit cards.
example[5]: events that turned Henry away from his family
